intro: Campuloclinium polyphyllum, commonly known as the many-leaved campuloclinium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves with a glossy surface and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
